meanings.definition: The act of carrying or transporting goods as a porter.
meanings.sent1: The porterage of heavy boxes was tiring for the workers.
meanings.sent2: We hired a porter for the porterage of our suitcases at the train station.
meanings.sent3: The porterage of the oversized watermelon made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to porterage was like a silent dance of strength and balance.
meanings.sent5: The image of porterage under the scorching sun stayed etched in their minds.

meanings.definition: The fee charged for carrying luggage or goods as a porter.
meanings.sent1: The hotel's porterage was reasonable compared to other places.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to tip the porter for the porterage of your bags.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected porterage fee left them wide-eyed.
meanings.sent4: The porterage felt like a small price to pay for convenience.
meanings.sent5: The porterage charge was clearly displayed at the entrance for all to see.
